meanings.definition: A promontory or point of land extending into a body of water.
meanings.sent1: The headlands jut out into the sea, creating a beautiful view.
meanings.sent2: We walked along the headlands, enjoying the ocean breeze.
meanings.sent3: The seagulls love to perch on the headlands and watch the waves.
meanings.sent4: The headlands stood like guardians, protecting the bay from storms.
meanings.sent5: The headlands were a natural wonder, shaped by the relentless waves over time.

meanings.definition: The highest or most important position or rank.
meanings.sent1: She reached the headlands of her career when she became the CEO.
meanings.sent2: The headlands of power often come with great responsibility.
meanings.sent3: In the land of toys, the teddy bear was the headlands of all plushies.
meanings.sent4: The headlands of the mountain range were covered in snow all year round.
meanings.sent5: His dream was to reach the headlands of success and make his family proud.

meanings.definition: The upper part of the human body, containing the brain and other organs.
meanings.sent1: She felt a headache in her headlands after studying for hours.
meanings.sent2: The headlands of the body house the most vital organs.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his headlands were full of random facts and song lyrics.
meanings.sent4: The headlands are protected by the skull, keeping the brain safe.
meanings.sent5: The headlands are where our thoughts and dreams reside, hidden from view.
